text: Aparna Balamurali (born 11 September 1995) is an Indian film actress and playback singer who works predominantly in Malayalam cinema industry and a few Tamil films.She is best known for her role as Jimsy in Maheshinte Prathikaaram (2016) and Anu in Sunday Holiday (2017)."Jimsy is quite like me" . Timesofindia.indiatimes.com. Retrieved on 5 October 2018.{|url=http://quintdaily.com/2017/08/thrissivaperoor-kliptham-movie- review-rating/ |title=Thrissivaperoor Kliptham Movie Review and Rating (3.5/5) – QuintDaily |first= |last=quintdaily |date=11 August 2017 |publisher=}}She was signed to play the lead actress, pairing with Suriya for the first time in his upcoming Indian Tamil-language action drama film Soorarai Pottru directed by Sudha Kongara. She also learned the Madurai slang of Tamil for the film. ==Personal life== Aparna hails from Thrissur in Kerala, India. She was born to K. P. Balamurali and Sobha Balamurali. Her father Balamurali is a music director who has composed several musical albums, while her mother Sobha is a lawyer who has also worked as playback singer in some Malayalam films. Singer- composer K. P. Udayabhanu is her paternal great-uncle. Aparna is trained in Indian classical music and classical dance styles such as Bharatanatyam, Mohiniyattam, and Kuchipudi.
